DataElement.preferredName: Past Week Hours Missing From Work Due To Problems Associated With Breast Carcinoma Number
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A persons' stated observation of how many hours they have missed from work in the past seven days because of their breast carcinoma.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Past Week Hour Missing From Work Due To Problem Associated With Breast Carcinoma
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The most recent week. May include the present day._A unit measure of time equal to 3,600 seconds or 60 minutes. It is approximately 1/24 of a median day._Not existing; not able to be found._Used to indicate a specified place or time as a starting point; used to indicate a source, cause, agent, or instrument._Exertion or effort directed to produce or accomplish something._Caused by or resulting from._A difficulty, disorder, or condition needing resolution._Joined in some kind of relationship._Used to indicate the presence of something or someone._A carcinoma arising from the breast, most commonly the terminal ductal-lobular unit. It is the most common malignant tumor in females. Risk factors include country of birth, family history, menstrual and reproductive history, fibrocystic disease and epithelial hyperplasia, exogenous estrogens, contraceptive agents, and ionizing radiation. The vast majority of breast carcinomas are adenocarcinomas (ductal or lobular). Breast carcinoma spreads by direct invasion, by the lymphatic route, and by the blood vessel route. The most common site of lymph node involvement is the axilla.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The most recent week. May include the present day.

Concepts.definition: The most recent week. May include the present day.

Property.preferredName: Hour Missing From Work Due To Problem Associated With Breast Carcinoma
Property.preferredDefinition: A unit measure of time equal to 3,600 seconds or 60 minutes. It is approximately 1/24 of a median day.:Not existing; not able to be found.:Used to indicate a specified place or time as a starting point; used to indicate a source, cause, agent, or instrument.:Exertion or effort directed to produce or accomplish something.:Caused by or resulting from.:A difficulty, disorder, or condition needing resolution.:Joined in some kind of relationship.:Used to indicate the presence of something or someone.:A carcinoma arising from the breast, most commonly the terminal ductal-lobular unit. It is the most common malignant tumor in females. Risk factors include country of birth, family history, menstrual and reproductive history, fibrocystic disease and epithelial hyperplasia, exogenous estrogens, contraceptive agents, and ionizing radiation. The vast majority of breast carcinomas are adenocarcinomas (ductal or lobular). Breast carcinoma spreads by direct invasion, by the lymphatic route, and by the blood vessel route. Concepts.definition: A unit measure of time equal to 3,600 seconds or 60 minutes. It is approximately 1/24 of a median day.
Not existing; not able to be found.
Used to indicate a specified place or time as a starting point; used to indicate a source, cause, agent, or instrument.
Exertion or effort directed to produce or accomplish something.
A difficulty, disorder, or condition needing resolution.
Joined in some kind of relationship.
Used to indicate the presence of something or someone.

A carcinoma arising from the breast, most commonly the terminal ductal-lobular unit. It is the most common malignant tumor in females. Risk factors include country of birth, family history, menstrual and reproductive history, fibrocystic disease and epithelial hyperplasia, exogenous estrogens, contraceptive agents, and ionizing radiation. The vast majority of breast carcinomas are adenocarcinomas (ductal or lobular). Breast carcinoma spreads by direct invasion, by the lymphatic route, and by the blood vessel route. The most common site of lymph node involvement is the axilla.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the number to represent a unit measure of time equal to 3,600 seconds or 60 minutes.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: In modern usage, an hour is defined as a unit of time 60 minutes, or 3600 seconds in length. It is approximately 1/24 of a median day.:Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification.

Concepts.definition: A unit measure of time equal to 3,600 seconds or 60 minutes. It is approximately 1/24 of a median day.
A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.

ValueDomain.origin: CALGB CRF:Cancer and Leukemia Group B Case Report Form
